name: Paulinho da Costa
description: '''Paulinho da Costa''' ({{IPA|pt|pawˈliɲu dɐ ˈkɔʃtɐ}}, born '''Paulo Roberto da Costa''' on May 31, 1948) is a Brazilian [[percussion instrument|percussionist]]. Beginning his career as a [[samba music]]ian in Brazil, he moved to the United States in the early 1970s and worked with Brazilian bandleader [[Sérgio Mendes]]. He went on to perform with many American pop, rock and jazz musicians and participated in thousands of albums. ''[[DownBeat]]'' magazine call him "one of the most talented percussionists of our time." He played on such albums as [[Earth, Wind & Fire]]'s ''[[I Am (Earth, Wind & Fire album)|I Am]]'', [[Michael Jackson]]'s ''[[Thriller (Michael Jackson album)|Thriller]]'', [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]]'s ''[[True Blue (Madonna album)|True Blue]]'', [[Celine Dion]]'s ''[[Let's Talk About Love]]'', hit singles and movie soundtracks, including ''[[Saturday Night Fever (soundtrack)|Saturday Night Fever]]'', ''[[Dirty Dancing (soundtrack)|Dirty Dancing]]'' and ''[[Purple Rain (album)|Purple Rain]]'' among others. He has also toured with [[Diana Krall]]. He plays over 200 instruments professionally, and has worked in a variety of [[music genre]]s including [[music of Brazil|Brazilian]], [[blues]], [[Christian music|Christian]], [[country music|country]], [[disco]], [[gospel music|gospel]], [[hip hop music|hip hop]], [[jazz]], [[Latin American music|Latin]], [[pop music|pop]], [[rhythm and blues]], [[rock music|rock]], [[soul music|soul]], and [[world music]]. He was signed to [[Norman Granz]]'s [[Pablo Records]] for three of his solo albums, ''[[Agora (da Costa album)|Agora]]'', ''[[Happy People (Paulinho da Costa album)|Happy People]]'' and ''[[Sunrise (Paulinho da Costa album)|Sunrise]]'', as well as ''[[Breakdown (Paulinho da Costa album)|Breakdown]]''. da Costa received the National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences' Most Valuable Player Award for three consecutive years. He also received the Musicians Emeritus Award.
